conclusion: Determine work done by gas during cyclic process by calculating work in each segment and summing them.
A→B is an isochoric process, B→C is an isobaric process, C→A is an isothermal process.
In isochoric process A→B, volume is constant, so no work is done, W_AB = 0.
From diagram, P_B = 4 x 10^5 Pa, V_B = 2 L, V_C = 5 L.
Work done in isobaric process B→C is W_BC = P_B (V_C - V_B) = 1200 J.
From diagram, V_A = 2 L, V_C = 5 L.
Given T_A = 200 K and P_A = 1 x 10^5 Pa.
Using ideal gas law, nRT = P_A V_A = 200 J.
Work done in isothermal process C→A is W_CA = 200 J ln(2/5) = -183.2 J.
Total work done W_total = W_AB + W_BC + W_CA = 1016.8 J.
Final answer: Work done by gas on surroundings is 1016.8 J.
